summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It details logistical arrangements for the public and victims to attend the hearing in person or via teleconference, including COVID-19 protocols and notification requirements for the government and defense counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order setting the arraignment and public access procedures.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse.

events.title: Deadline for Victim and Family Attendance Notification
events.description: The Government and defense counsel must inform the Court by email whether any alleged victims or the defendant's family members wish to attend the arraignment and how.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment was scheduled for April 23, 2021.
The court order establishes specific COVID-19 protocols for courthouse entry, including mask requirements and temperature checks.
The court provided both in-person overflow viewing and a public teleconference line to accommodate significant public interest in the proceeding.
The government was ordered to notify the court if any alleged victims wished to attend, highlighting victim rights under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771.
Defense counsel was similarly ordered to notify the court regarding attendance by the defendant's family members.
